blue guy*

It’s a solid rare to include and buy some time in fights. It's not a flashy or exciting card, but it does what it needs to do. Getting 2 turns of blur with enough block to realistically carry it over between them can smooth out your draws well and help cover inconsistencies. It can also be very powerful if used just before some of the really dangerous attacks in the spire, like hyper beam, playing it during an off turn against the heart, nemesis, or gremlin leader. It also work really well with the plated armor from your cards, and the relics thread and needle and brass tacks. I wouldn’t normally buy this from a shop, and there are usually better/more important rares on offer from boss rewards. I’m generally pretty happy to have this in my deck, it performs well, but it’s not a priority. Upgrade is really nice to make it easier to blur some block over. Runic pyramid plays very well with it to time the blur for more useful turns. I don't think it would be outrageous if the rate on this was a little bit better (maybe 14 block regular, 20 upgraded), as it can feel a little anemic once you get to higher ascensions.

messages.content: Dissolve is pretty good. Its basically just 2 blurs stacked on top of each other (although it has a nice +6 block upgrade). Dissolve isn't blocking attacks by itself, but having 2 turns of block retention helps you make the most out of your other block cards. Which helps a lot since hermit can struggle to have consistent block throughout a fight. Dissolve can make your deck a lot more consistent since if you have a hand with just block cards they don't go to waste as long as you have dissolve. Like many of hermits powerful cards dissolve does exhaust making it a short burst of power rather then a build around card. still it consistently does well for me so I respect this card a lot

My main issue is that 12(18) block is NOT enough for most mid game fights, and is a joke in late game. The reason why blur works in silent is because she has ways of stacking dexterity to absurd amounts and easily getting enough block to carry over, where hermit does not have these abilities. Hermit has some minor dex scaling in maintenance but not enough draw, weak, or block cards to take advantage of it properly in the same way silent does.

Weirdly enough I've found that this card works best with dive and scavenge, but not for any reason I've seen mentioned yet. Most people like the synergy because plated armor is an easy way to get a lot of block, and this is a way to store it. However I will argue that the true strength of dissolve when partnered with plated armor is actually in the setup. In the earlier turns in the fight you can play dissolve and dive to get started on your plated armor without as much threat of taking damage and losing it, and the more plated armor you get the stronger it is, as it becomes even harder to lose it.

Hermit has good draw cards. Dissolve can even be directly filtered out with cursed hand (a great combo is to have dissolve and overwhelming power so hand grabs them both). Your not expecting dissolve to block attacks by itself like an impervious; you want dissolve to make your existing block engine more effective.
Hermit has complicated draw cards, and even when used optimally it still pales in comparison to silent unless you just take 99% 0 cost cards and luck of the draw but oop time eater is gonna kill you
Hermit's block game isn't horrible and unusable but it's by far his weakest aspect, especially going into acts 3 and 4.

Hermit's block game is...
interesting
Yeah it's very unique, and I like it, but I can definitely see why some people find it offputting
You often end up with a hodgepodge of stuff
Yeah hermit has the most uncohesive cohesive block engines
